visaTypes.definition: The F-1 student visa is a type of nonimmigrant visa for individuals who wish to study in the U.S. as a full-time student.
visaTypes.requirements: Students need an F-1 visa if their course of study is more than 18 hours a week.

visaTypes.definition: The M-1 visa is a type of nonimmigrant visa in the United States that allows students to pursue vocational or nonacademic programs, including training in technical or mechanical fields.
visaTypes.requirements: To be eligible for an M-1 visa, the student must be enrolled in an approved program, have sufficient funds to support themselves without working in the US, and have a residence abroad to which they intend to return.

visaTypes.definition: This type of study visa is for participation in USA exchange programs.

courseTypes.type: Vocational and other non-academic training institutes except language training

applicationRequirements.requirement: Passport with at least 6 months validity
Fee receipt of paying non-refundable 160 US dollar visa application fee
An approved I-20 form issued by the US university

applicationProcess.step: Complete the non-immigrant visa electronic form (DS-160)
Pay the SEVIS fee of US$ 350
Pay visa application fee: Pay the application fee of US$160 in any Allied Bank
Schedule/ book an online appointment, need followings for appointment confirmation
requirements: Receipt number from visa fee receipt
10 digit barcode (find it on the DS-160 form)

applicationProcess.step: Go for an interview to US embassy Islamabad on the given date and time

additionalInformation.info: If a student misses more than five months of class, they should apply for and be granted a new F-1 or M-1 student visa before they can resume their studies.
